SENT.plain: A 17-year-old male diagnosed as having Cat Eye Syndrome (CES) with hypogonadotropic hypogonadism showed short stature and no development of secondary sex characteristics
Exogeneous gonadotropin replacement therapy combining human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG) and human menopausal gonadotropin (hMG) was started
As a result, the short stature and androgen deficiency were relieved
The critical region of CES was tetrasomy of 22 pter-->q11
Abnormalities of other chromosomes which cause hypogonadotropic hypogonadism may exist, thus further investigation is needed
